channel.title: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
channel.description: Need to know what run.bat code will work for anyone

item.title: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:9, topic:444811”]You need to change the directory to where the cache is read.

Modify the singlink to something similar.

public static final String cacheDirectory() {
    return "cache" + System.getProperty("user.home");
}[/code][/quote]
Ah thanks;p.
[quote="s1gma, post:10, topic:444811"][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=547497.msg4014679#msg4014679 date=1339524417]
Uhhmm, intresting. What would be a good way for us noobs to make it possible for mac users and linux users play any client that we provide?
[/quote]say we had a batch file
[code=batch]@echo off
java ./Client
pause

what you have there is pretty much of the linux/mac version, the main difference is removing any DOS specific directives/commands and throwing a shebang (interpreter-location directive) line at the top. certain commands are a bit redundant too ie. pause since one can just execute in the terminal.
the loose equivalent of the former in linux/mac would be

#!/usr/bin/env bash java ./Client
(the shebang may be variable, using /usr/bin/env should work for os x and most linux boxes)[/quote]
I get the general jist of what your saying, unfortunatly I don’t really understand what your saying fully but when I do try this I’ll be sure to use my good friend google to understand what your saying better and of course the client help section;p.

[quote=“Native^, post:11, topic:444811”][quote author=s1gma link=topic=547497.msg4014674#msg4014674 date=1339524262]

You could create a JAR (Java Application Resource).

JAR = Java Archive?,
But yeah, don’t use those batch files. Jar the client, or make executable files for all platforms. (.exe for Windows, .app for Mac, and probably a shell script for Linux)
[/quote]making executable files? what the fuck? you’ve solved absolutely nothing by removing the system-dependent batch file and replacing it with a system-dependent executable (ps the equivalent on Linux would be an ELF executable). the best way to go in that case would be just having a batch file and shell script (mac and linux should be able to use the same script), but i don’t see why you can’t jar the client and request users to double click it.

True that, but I think it’s not very user friendly to have a command prompt show up, especially for people that are not into computers. But just a jar is fine either.[/quote]
I’ll stick with a .jar for just now and see if any linux/mac users(if I have any) complain, if so I’ll try out what he’s saying.

Btw thanks for the help, favourited this thread :p.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client

item.title: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:5, topic:444811”][quote author=Native^ link=topic=547497.msg4014475#msg4014475 date=1339510817]

You could create a JAR (Java Application Resource).

JAR = Java Archive?,
But yeah, don’t use those batch files. Jar the client, or make executable files for all platforms. (.exe for Windows, .app for Mac, and probably a shell script for Linux)
[/quote]making executable files? what the fuck? you’ve solved absolutely nothing by removing the system-dependent batch file and replacing it with a system-dependent executable (ps the equivalent on Linux would be an ELF executable). the best way to go in that case would be just having a batch file and shell script (mac and linux should be able to use the same script), but i don’t see why you can’t jar the client and request users to double click it.[/quote]
True that, but I think it’s not very user friendly to have a command prompt show up, especially for people that are not into computers. But just a jar is fine either.

item.title: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:6, topic:444811”]Uhhmm, intresting. What would be a good way for us noobs to make it possible for mac users and linux users play any client that we provide?[/quote]say we had a batch file

@echo off java ./Client pause
what you have there is pretty much of the linux/mac version, the main difference is removing any DOS specific directives/commands and throwing a shebang (interpreter-location directive) line at the top. certain commands are a bit redundant too ie. pause since one can just execute in the terminal.
the loose equivalent of the former in linux/mac would be

#!/usr/bin/env bash java ./Client
(the shebang may be variable, using /usr/bin/env should work for os x and most linux boxes)

item.title: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

You need to change the directory to where the cache is read.

Modify the singlink to something similar.

public static final String cacheDirectory() { return "cache" + System.getProperty("user.home"); }

Read full topic

item.title: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:7, topic:444811”]JAR the client, make sure you do NOT have any pre-loading sprites, animations, hard coded shit, etc. or the client will be all black upon log in, and make sure that the cache path is somewhere where each operating system can retrieve it. (Not C:/)! i/e: user.home.

@Native: I just Google’d it, I found both names being correct. (I think!)[/quote]
Thanks for the post. So this directory > C:\Users\ ? Bit confused, you always have to put it in C:/use the c: directory;o…

Read full topic
item.source: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client

item.title: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

JAR the client, make sure you do NOT have any pre-loading sprites, animations, hard coded shit, etc. or the client will be all black upon log in, and make sure that the cache path is somewhere where each operating system can retrieve it. (Not C:/)! i/e: user.home.

@Native: I just Google’d it, I found both names being correct. (I think!)

Read full topic

item.title: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
item.dc:creator: @Native1 Native^
item.description:
@Native1 wrote:

AtomicInt_:

You could create a JAR (Java Application Resource).

JAR = Java Archive?,
But yeah, don’t use those batch files. Jar the client, or make executable files for all platforms. (.exe for Windows, .app for Mac, and probably a shell script for Linux)

Read full topic
item.source: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client

item.title: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

One will not simply not work for ‘everyone.’

There are people who use Mac, and Linux based machines, they cannot run a Windows Batch File. (Unless they have WINE)

You could create a JAR (Java Application Resource) file, and release it for the public to download. That will work for everyone as long as they have Java, because Java is cross-platform.

Read full topic
item.source: Whats a guarunteed run.bat code for a 317 pi client
